channel.title: Spirited History
channel.description:
A weekly podcast that explores rich historic locations throughout the US that are kept alive by the communities that love them. We feature the sites history and some of the spirits that are reported to linger.
Please Email us at spiritedhistory@gmail.com
If you have a site you would like us to highlight on our show drop us a line!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Where our spirits and history come togeather.
channel.itunes:author: Spirited History
channel.itunes:summary:
A weekly podcast that explores rich historic locations throughout the US that are kept alive by the communities that love them. We feature the sites history and some of the spirits that are reported to linger.
Please Email us at spiritedhistory@gmail.com
If you have a site you would like us to highlight on our show drop us a line!

item.title: "Haunts of Wisconsin" with Devon and Tony Bell!
item.description: Please join Angela and LeeAnne as they uncover the unusual history and paranormal activity in the documentary: “Caryville” created by our guests, Devon and Tony Bell. We will also be exploring the many haunted locations in Devon’s new second book, “Haunted WI.” We may even get a hint about their next documentary on haunted locations in Minnesota! This dynamic duo are the creators of the web series “Haunting Experiments.” They are a paranormal production team who specialize in video production and produce ghost lore shows, documentaries, and docudramas. Devon and Tony find the paranormal world very intriguing and love bringing it to the silver screen! Link: http://thehauntingexperiments.synthasite.com/
item.dc:creator: Spirited History

Devon and Tony find the paranormal world very intriguing and love bringing it to the silver screen!
Link:
http://thehauntingexperiments.synthasite.com/

item.title: Haunted Prisons with Kathleen Tedsen and Beverlee Rydel
item.description: Please join LeeAnne and Angela as they explore the hauntings that are occurring at two of the most paranormally active prisons in the United States with Kathleen Tedsen and Beverlee Rydel. By day Kat and Bev write about the paranormal and at night they look for proof of the paranormal. They travel throughout Michigan and Ohio going to public locations searching for spirits, often with some outstanding paranormal teams. They co-created, investigate/research and write, The Haunted Travels of Michigan book project. They are the authors of a series of paranormal books with interactive websites. Each book in the Haunted Travels series takes the reader into the history and brings them into our paranormal investigation of the location. All stories are linked to their website where evidence recorded during the investigation can be seen. They have two books in this series available at most major bookstores now. Currently working on the next one. Kat and Bev also offer paranormal investigations at some of the most haunted sights in the country. 　 Link: http://www.hauntedtravelsmi.com/

item.title: Phantoms abound in California's wine country with Dr. Dwyer
item.description: Please join Angela and LeeAnne as they explore the haunting is California’s wine country with author and paranormal investigator, Dr. Jeff Dwyer, Ph.D. Dr. Dwyer conducts historical research as it pertains to ghostly and paranormal phenomena and investigate haunted sites using highly developed psychic methods that include remote viewing, psychometry, and clairvoyance. He then uses this material generated by these investigations to write his informative books. Dr. Dwyer keeps busy with his paranormal investigations, writing projects, personal appearances at book events, radio and TV appearances, and a demanding job as a clinical specialist in cardiology at a busy medical center. He has also written three novels and a TV movie script–Sailor on Horseback–that chronicles the final three years in the life of legendary writer Jack London. Link: http://www.jeffdwyer.com/home

item.title: Live Spirited History Investigation for Richmond VA Poe Museum
item.description: Join LeeAnne and Angela as they take you on a paranormal and historic tour of The Poe Museum in Richmond VA, for a live broadcast from this legendary museum. The show and investigation will be simulcast on Para-X-Vision. Come along on the investigation of one of the most haunted locations in Virginia. Watch live and let us know if you see any paranormal activity happening! Link: http://www.poemuseum.org/index.php

item.title: Brownella Cottage with Dr. Gruber
item.description: Join Angela and LeeAnne as they uncover the supernatural occurrences at the Brownella Cottage with Dr. Gruber. Dr. Gruber is an EVP specialist and the Founder of Supernatural, Paranormal and Technical Services. Brownella Cottage was recently featured on the “My Ghost Stories” season finale! Is Bishop Brown still roaming the halls of Brownella? Many local individuals think so! Link: http://www.facebook.com/GalionHistoricalSociety

item.title: Patrick Henry's Scotchtown
item.description: Join Angela and LeeAnne as the explore Patrick Henry’s home, “Scotchtown”. Spirited History is the first paranormal team to investigate this historic site for paranormal activity. What they have found at this remarkable location will truly amaze you! They will be sharing a few of the EVPS that have been collected at this historic site. Scotchtown is best known as the home of Patrick Henry during the tumultuous years leading up to the American Revolution. It was at Scotchtown that he formulated the ideas of his famous “Liberty or Death” speech and it was from the house that he rode to St. John’s Church in Richmond on March 23, 1775 to deliver it. If you are interested in investigating Scotchtown for paranormal activity with Spirited History listen and find out how you can purchase tickets to attend this exciting event. www.spiritedhistory.com Link: http://preservationvirginia.org/visit/historic-properties/patrick-henrys-scotchtown

item.title: Cataline Island Specters
item.description: Join LeeAnne and Angela while they explore the history, lore and hauntings of Cataline Island off the coast of California.

item.title: Spectral Voices with Karen Mossey & Mike Sullivan
item.description: Join LeeAnne and Angela as they chat with Karen Mossey & Mike Sullivan! They are paranormal investigators based in New England who specialize in Electronic Voice Phenomena and Paranormal Photography. Grab your headphones and listen up as they share some of their best EVP's and talk about some of the different techniques they are using to capture spirit photography. Links: http://ectoweb.com/

item.title: Bacon's Castle Revisited!
item.description: We were excited and honored to investigate Bacon's Castle in Surry, VA. Join us as we explore some of the history and spirits of this amazing Jacobean style home that was built in 1665! Built by Arthur Allen on his original land grant of 200 acres; this architectural wonder has stood the test of time and played a significant role in Bacon's Rebellion. So sit back and join us as we travel through Spirited History. Links: http://preservationvirginia.org/BaconsCastle/ http://preservationvirginia.org/BaconsCastle/BaconsRebellion.php http://www.spiritedhistory.com/ http://sky.radio.com/shows/spirited-history/

item.title: Historic Deadwood and the Adams House with Black Hills Paranormal Investigations
item.description: LeeAnne and Angela are joined by Josh Wennes and Susan Parsons or Black hills Paranormal Investigations to talk about their findings at the Adams House and the Historic Deadwood Brothel district in South Dakota. They have some great history and fantastic EVP's to share, so sit back and join us as we travel through Spirited History! Links: http://www.bhparanormal.com/index.htm *Urgent* Please go to this link and help preserve our history! item.title: Dana Stewart Wingered Parapaloosa Phenomenology 104 Gettysburg PA!
item.description: Join LeeAnne and Angela as they chat with Dana about her paranormal group NEPI. ( North Eastern Paranormal Investigations) Their goal is to help those who believe they are experiencing paranormal activity. Each of their cases are conducted in a professional, and scientific manner. Their client's safety, and peace of mind is their number one priority. Honesty, compassion, dedication, and respect are not only the keys to a thorough investigation, they are the tight bond of trust, and friendship that is N.E.P.I. We will be chatting about The Phenomenology 104 Parapaloosa Event. This is an amazing paranormal event that hosts the top in the paranormal field, paranormal investigations, workshops, a vendor room and much much more! Listen and find out which one of your favorite paranormal stars will be attending. Links: http://northeasternparanormal.org/index.html http://www.phenomevents.com/index.html

item.title: Ghostly Voices from the Past - EVP Night
item.description: Join Angela and LeeAnne as they share the many ghostly voices captured during audio sessions at some of the most haunted locations across the United States. Be sure to bring your headphones and snuggle in to hear these Electronic Voice Phenomena.
item.dc:creator: Spirited History
item.itunes:summary: Join Angela and LeeAnne as they share the many ghostly voices captured during audio sessions at some of the most haunted locations across the United States. Be sure to bring your headphones and snuggle in to hear these Electronic Voice Phenomena.

item.title: "Ghost Cats and Dogs of the South" with Author and Folklorist Randy Russell
item.description: We have the pleasure of exploring the many tales of ghost cats and dogs of the South as well as some of the ghostly tales from across the south he has collected. Randy is an academically trained folklorist who has collected hundreds of first-person accounts of ghost experiences from across the South. He presents regularly on “True Ghost Stories of the South” based on his interviews of people who have encountered ghosts. The Edgar-nominated author of five published novels for adults, two books of short stories about ghosts, and two volumes of Southern Appalachia folklore, Randy’s first paranormal novel, Dead Rules , was released in hardcover by HarperTeen on June 21, 2011. Link: http://www.ghostfolk.com/ Link:
item.dc:creator: Spirited History

item.title: "Haunting at the Farrar School" with Nancy Oliver
item.description: We will have the pleasure of chatting with Nancy Oliver about the haunting that is occurring at the Farrar School in Farrar Iowa. The large 17,000 square foot schoolhouse looks out of place in the small town of Farrar, Iowa. Over the decades employees and students reported hearing voices, slamming doors and sightings of unnatural figures walking the halls. After sitting abandoned for five years, Jim and Nancy Oliver purchased the building in 2006. It quickly became apparent they were not alone. Are you brave enough to stay the night? On the other hand, maybe a daylight tour with one of the owners would better suit you. Maybe you don’t have the nerve! Links: http://www.facebook.com/HauntingAtFarrar http://www.hauntingatfarrar.com/

item.title: Ghosts and Legends of Oklahoma with Mike Ricksecker
item.description: We will be exploring the ghosts and legends from Mike Rickseckers new book, “Ghosts and Legends of Oklahoma.” Mike is the author of "Deadly Heirs, a Chase Michael DeBarlo mystery novel", "Ghosts of Maryland" and "Ghosts and Legends of Oklahoma". While in Oklahoma Mike has helped found the Society of the Haunted; a paranormal investigative team serving the greater Oklahoma and Texas area. Mike has appeared on Animal Planet's "The Haunted" television show, he regularly speaks about the paranormal and writing and is currently a paranormal investigator and "ghostorian" with Society of the Haunted. Links: http://www.mikericksecker.com/ http://societyofthehaunted.com/ http://www.examiner.com/paranormal-140-in-oklahoma-city/michael-ricksecker http://www.twitter.com/mikericksecker

item.title: "Haunting Connections" with Psychic David Allen Brown
item.description: We have the pleasure of talking with psychic David Allen Brown about the haunted sites he has explored and the many spirits he has encountered. He will also be doing live New Year readings for our listeners who call in or join us in our chat room. Mr. Brown is a very gifted psychic who is has developed his abilities if clairvoyance, clairaudience, spirit communication, spirit rescue, psychometry, remote viewing, psychic prediction, life purpose readings, psychic advising, house readings, house clearings, and environmental readings. Links: http://www.pmkane.com/davidallenbrown/bio.htm

item.title: Tales of the Miraculous
item.description: Join LeeAnne and Angela as they explore some Tales of the Miraculous. A miracle is a phenomenon not understood or explainable by known laws of nature, or an act by some supernatural entity or unknown outside force. What miracles maybe happening or have happened around you in the past?
item.dc:creator: Spirited History
item.itunes:summary: Join LeeAnne and Angela as they explore some Tales of the Miraculous. A miracle is a phenomenon not understood or explainable by known laws of nature, or an act by some supernatural entity or unknown outside force. What miracles maybe happening or have happened around you in the past?

item.title: Episode 36 Ghosts of Maryland
item.description: We had the pleasure of chatting with Mike Ricksecker the author of,"Ghosts of Maryland". Join us as we explore the many hauntings and interesting history of some of Marylands most spirited sites. Mike Ricksecker is the author of Deadly Heirs, a Chase Michael DeBarlo mystery novel, and Ghosts of Maryland. The son of a tool and die maker, Mike spent ten years growing up in western Massachusetts and began writing detective fiction as far back as the second grade. He carried his passion of writing with him back to Ohio, the state of his birth, where he created a myriad of short stories, novellas, and song lyrics. The character, Chase Michael DeBarlo, was also seen in print for the first time during this period. After a 6-year stint in the U.S. Air Force that bounced him between Texas, Mississippi, Alaska, and Maryland, Mike resumed his detective fiction by beginning to create an interactive computer game. During the project, he realized his true passion and began the task of writing a full-length novel. The game concept is still in development at this time, and the precursors can be experienced through the mini-mystery games available via the Mike Ricksecker Mystery newsletter. While at Ft. George G. Meade, MD, Mike was the editor for The Monitor, the 29th Intelligence Squadron newsletter. The editor position basically meant doing 75% of the writing and 100% of the layout, but enjoyable none-the-less. Also worth noting is the flyer titled “The Issues” Mike created for the George W. Bush presidential campaign which was used nation-wide in 2000. This flyer is still available for download. In 2004, Deadly Heirs, the first installment of the Chase Michael DeBarlo mystery series was published. The not-yet-published sequel has been completed with a third in the works. Although Mike and his family moved to Oklahoma in 2009, Ghosts of Maryland was published by Schiffer Publishing in 2010. He subsequently inked a deal to write a similar paranormal tome about ghosts and legends in Oklahoma, and the work is currently in production. Mike has been married to his wife, Robin, for sixteen years and they have four children. Links: http://www.rrdevelopments.com/mike/ http://www.facebook.com/mricksecker

The son of a tool and die maker, Mike spent ten years growing up in western Massachusetts and began writing detective fiction as far back as the second grade. He carried his passion of writing with him back to Ohio, the state of his birth, where he created a myriad of short stories, novellas, and song lyrics. The character, Chase Michael DeBarlo, was also seen in print for the first time during this period.
After a 6-year stint in the U.S. Air Force that bounced him between Texas, Mississippi, Alaska, and Maryland, Mike resumed his detective fiction by beginning to create an interactive computer game. During the project, he realized his true passion and began the task of writing a full-length novel. The game concept is still in development at this time, and the precursors can be experienced through the mini-mystery games available via the Mike Ricksecker Mystery newsletter.
While at Ft. George G. Meade, MD, Mike was the editor for The Monitor, the 29th Intelligence Squadron newsletter. The editor position basically meant doing 75% of the writing and 100% of the layout, but enjoyable none-the-less. Also worth noting is the flyer titled “The Issues” Mike created for the George W. Bush presidential campaign which was used nation-wide in 2000. This flyer is still available for download.
In 2004, Deadly Heirs, the first installment of the Chase Michael DeBarlo mystery series was published. The not-yet-published sequel has been completed with a third in the works.
Although Mike and his family moved to Oklahoma in 2009, Ghosts of Maryland was published by Schiffer Publishing in 2010. He subsequently inked a deal to write a similar paranormal tome about ghosts and legends in Oklahoma, and the work is currently in production.
Mike has been married to his wife, Robin, for sixteen years and they have four children.

item.title: Hauntings In My Head with Angela K Burke
item.description: Angela and I had the pleasure of chatting with Angela Dalton Lucius who is the author of, "Hauntings In My Head", under her pen name Angela L Burke. "Hauntings In My Head" is a collection of ghostly southern poetry. This is a marvelous book chock full of intriguing stories, prose, poetry and haunting tales. Ms. Burke is also the co-founder-case and research management- website manager-lead investigator of the MSSPI Group, Mississippi Society of Paranormal Investigator's, which was founded in November 2008. Angela is a graduate of Oakland Community College, Southfield Michigan, with a degree in Practical Nurse Education.She has 20 years of Geriatric and Psychiatric Nursing, as well as Hospice experience and dealing with family grief and the subject of death and dying. In 2000, she was awarded Best Nurse in East Texas, Readers Choice Award, by the Longview News Journal, Longview, Texas. She has had many personal experiences with the paranormal since the age of 8, from witnessing apparitions and poltergeist activities to living in a haunted farmhouse. She has a deep interest in cemetery photography and preservation, and working with EVP and still imagery. She is also a book worm and loves researching history, world religions, spirituality & cultures, death & funeral rituals and genealogy. She takes volunteer headstone photos for Findagrave.com and is currently in the process of doing research for an upcoming Mississippi History, Legends & Hauntings book that she and Shelly will be writing together. She is also the author of Headboards of Stone Graveyard Rabbits Cemetery Blog. and also writes and compiles research for the new MSSPI Research Room Blog Angela is engaged to Tony Burke who is also on the MSSPI team. She has 4 grown children, one granddaughter and a new grandchild due in Jan 2011. Links: http://authspot.com/short-stories/the-ghost-of-clara-barton/ http://www.headboardsofstone.blogspot.com/ http://www.mississippi-spi.com

item.title: Randall Keller~"Voices From Forever"
item.description: Angela and I were delighted to have as our guest Randall Keller who has written a very thought provoking book on EVP Research. Join us in this episode as we explore this informative and engaging book, "Voices From Forever". Links: Perry Hall Paranormal Research Society http://www.phprs.org/ "Voices From Forever" Podcast: http://voicesfromforever.mypodcast.com/ Randall Keller Photo Site: http://www.thegallery2.com/artists/keller/group1.html EVP Site: http://evp.thegallery2.com/evp/index.html
item.dc:creator: Spirited History

item.title: Phenomenal Photography with Craig Rupp
item.description: We had the pleasure of chatting with Craig Rupp. He is a talented freelance paranormal investigator who specializes in Daylight IR Photography and Evp Research. Join us as we discuss his photographic and evp techniques and explore the many incredible evps, photos and paranormal investigations he has performed. Contact Craig Rupp: Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/?sk=messages#!/profile.php?id=100000710737131 Email: crupp298@gmail.com

item.title: Episode 32
item.description: Hey gang join the Spirited History gals as we uncover Hauntings in the Southwest and Washington's Haunted HotSpots with author and historian Linda Moffitt. Websites: http://www.lindamoffitt.com/ http://www.examiner.com/x-31290-Seattle-Haunted-Places-Examiner http://www.myspace.com/lindamoffitt http://www.facebook.com/?ref=home#!/pages/Linda-Moffitt/105261124235?ref=ts
